page.title: 14FARMING: PENPONDS FARM
page.content: {Special note:}The following sections contain a detailed description of a typical farm in our area, in this case specializing in dairy farming. _____ {Penponds Farm,}near Threemilestone, is an example of a dairy farm. The farm has a mixed herd of 20 Freisian, Jersey and Guernsey cows, along with 5 calves raised specifically for beef purposes due to strict milk quotas this year. The 42 acres of land in Penponds Farm consists of 34 acres near to the farmhouse, and 8 acres at Langarth (1 mile away). The farm machinery used on the land includes a foage harvester for silage, an old tractor/mower, a turner for grass, and manure/fertilizer spreaders. The grass on the land,occasionally reseeded, is cut for{silage,}both clamp silage and roundbate silage.
